data.title: Kwasi Kwarteng Reportedly Sacked as UK Finance Minister
data.description: British Prime Minister Liz Truss has sacked Chancellor of the Exchequer Kwasi Kwarteng ahead of an expected Reversal of his mini-budget last month.

data.title: Belarus Terminates Two International Financing Agreements With EU
data.description: MINSK (Sputnik) - The government of Belarus has terminated two agreements with the European Union on financing under a decree published on Thursday.

data.title: Hunt Goes for a Hunt on a Black Hole in British Public Finance
data.description: UK Chancellor Jeremy Hunt is facing tough times since he needs to plug a 55 billion-pound hole in British public finance amidst economic crisis.

data.title: Sweden 'Heading Towards a Grim Winter,' Finance Minister Warns
data.description: In a recent October survey, 51 percent of Swedes said that they see a dark or very dark future, whereas a fresh review by the National Institute of Economic Research indicated record-pessimistic expectations by Swedish households for the next twelve months.

data.title: G7 Finance Ministers Reportedly Agree on Price Cap for Russian Oil
data.description: G7 Finance Ministers Reportedly Agree on Price Cap for Russian Oil

data.title: German Finance Ministry Issues ‘Gloomy’ Outlook for Country’s Economic Development
data.description: Last month, Oya Celasun, Assistant Director in the IMF's European Department, argued that the German economy may face “significant downside risks” in the near future due to gas supply shortages.

data.title: West Tries to Sideline Africa on Global Stage, Finance Ministers Say
data.description: The African continent, forced to content with floods and drought along with regional conflicts, has also been bearing the brunt of external shocks, originally triggered by the COVID-19 pandemic. Disruptions in supply chains fed into soaring energy and food prices spurred by inflation and the fallout from the conflict in Ukraine.

data.title: Russian Embassy in Italy Calls Report on Alleged Financing of Parties Manipulation
data.description: MOSCOW (Sputnik) - The Russian Embassy in Rome on Wednesday dismissed a report on Moscow's alleged financing of foreign parties and called it manipulation of public opinion ahead of elections.

data.title: Russian Finance Ministry Says Attempts to Recognize Russian Diamonds as 'Bloody' Unfounded
data.description: MOSCOW, (Sputnik) - The Russian finance ministry said on Wednesday that proposals of some Western countries to label Russian diamonds "bloody" are unfounded and speculative.

data.title: Iraqi Finance Minister Resigns Amid Severe Political Crisis in Country: Report
data.description: MOSCOW (Sputnik) - Iraqi Finance Minister Ali Allawi resigned amid a severe political crisis in the country, Iraqi News Agency reported on Tuesday, citing a source familiar with the matter.

data.title: G7 Finance Ministers Say Group Committed to Reaching Net Zero by 2050
data.description: MOSCOW (Sputnik) - The Group of Seven (G7) is committed to the implementation of the 2016 Paris Agreement and is planning to achieve carbon neutrality by 2050, the group's finance ministers and central bank governors said on Wednesday.

data.title: Chile Day in London next December 12/13. Finance minister attending
data.description: Chilean Finance minister Mario Marcel will be attending the eleventh edition of the Chile Day in London scheduled to take place next December with the purpose of strengthening economic and financial relations between the two countries in a raft of disciplines. The two-day event is expected to take place 12/13 December.

data.title: UAE, Singapore Working to Make India’s RuPay ‘Acceptable’ in Their Countries, Finance Minister Says
data.description: In addition to exporting its domestic payments systems to other countries, Delhi has been involved in negotiations with several governments to advance bilateral trade in local currencies. The efforts are designed to encourage the settlement of international transactions in the Indian rupee and other national currencies rather than the US dollar.

data.title: Japan to Coordinate With Sri Lankan Creditors to Restructure Foreign Debt, Finance Minister Says
data.description: Japan is among Sri Lanka’s biggest bilateral creditors, with its loans to Colombo totalling around $3 billion. Sri Lankan President Ranil Wickremesinghe said in an interview this month that he would ask Japan to invite the country’s main creditors for a conference in order to reach a consensus on the debt restructuring programme.

data.title: India's 5G Technology 'Completely Indigenous', Can Be Exported to Other Nations - Finance Minister
data.description: India has pinned high hopes on the “cumulative economic benefits” of the 5G technology unveiled this month. The government has said that “economic benefits” from 5G could reach $450 billion by 2035.

data.title: Japan's Trade Deficit With Russia Up 163% to $5.1Bln in April-September: Finance Ministry
data.description: TOKYO (Sputnik) - Japan's trade deficit with Russia jumped 163% to 750.5 billion yen ($5.1 billion) in the first half of the 2022 fiscal yea, which started on April 1, compared with the same period last year, according to data released by the Japanese finance ministry on Wednesday.

data.title: Japan's Finance Minister Vows Another Intervention as Yen Falls to 32-Year Low
data.description: TOKYO (Sputnik) - Japanese Finance Minister Shunichi Suzuki said on Friday that Tokyo is closely monitoring market developments and is set to take appropriate measures amid the continuing fall of the national currency and speculation-driven fluctuations.

data.title: India Introduces Rupee Trade to Reduce Dependence on 'Hard Currency,' Finance Minister Says
data.description: India's most common hard currencies for trade are the US dollar, British pound, and the euro. Last month, the Reserve Bank of India (RBI) allowed international trade to be settled in Indian rupees, as Western states previously slapped sanctions on Russia, Iran, and several Latin American countries with whom Delhi has a substantial trade.

data.title: Importing Crude From Russia Part of India's ‘Inflation Management’ Policy, Finance Minister Says
data.description: Indian retail inflation in July was roughly 6.7 percent higher than in 2021 in the same month, largely due to volatility in global food and fuel prices triggered by Western sanctions against Russia over its military operation in Ukraine. India's top bank, the RBI, aims to reduce the overall inflation to below 6 percent.

data.title: Japan in July Again Imported Oil From Russia, But Volume Dropped 65% - Finance Ministry
data.description: TOKYO (Sputnik) - Japan in July again began to import oil from Russia, but its volumes decreased by 65 percent ​​compared to July 2021, the Japanese Finance Ministry said in a statement.

data.title: Indian Lenders Working With Russian Banks to Settle Trade in Rupees, Finance Ministry Official Says
data.description: Delhi amended its foreign trade policy last month to allow international trade to be paid in the national currency. The new mechanism is designed to help Indian businesses in their trade with Russia without the threat of US sanctions.

data.title: Pakistan Finance Minister Resigns as Sharif Gov’t Faces Imran Khan’s Scorn Over Inflation
data.description: Pakistan has been facing the threat of a default on its foreign debt due to dwindling foreign exchange reserves. The coalition government led by Prime Minister Shehbaz Sharif has raised fuel prices at a record level since it took the reigns in April, triggering severe criticism from the country's former leader Imran Khan.

data.title: Pakistan Wants to Buy Oil From Russia at the Same Price as India, Finance Minister Says
data.description: According to India's Finance Minister, Delhi’s oil purchases from Moscow have increased from 2 per cent to 12 per cent of the overall imports since February. Importing crude from Russia is part of India's “inflation-management” strategy in view of high global prices, the minister explained.

data.title: COP27:India Accuses Rich Countries of 'Enormous Failure' Over Climate Finance for Developing Nations
data.description: tCO2e (tonne carbon dioxide equivalent) in 2020, far below that of the global average of 6.3 tCO2e. On the other hand, the per capita emissions in the US stood at 14 tCO2e in 2020, while those of China were 9.7 tCO2e.

data.title: Ukraine’s Finance Minister Reports Problems Finding Cash to Pay Troops Despite West’s Aid Bonanza
data.description: The US and its allies have approved over $76 billion in military and fiscal aid to Kiev, equivalent to 40% of Ukraine’s GDP in 2021. However, much of this assistance doesn’t seem to be reaching its intended destinations, with CBS issuing (and then deleting) a story last week showing that as little as 30% of the military aid was reaching the front.

data.title: GOP Senate Candidate Who Supports Abortion Ban Revealed as Having Financed Ex-Girlfriend’s Abortion
data.description: Herschel Walker, a Republican candidate for the US Senate from the state of Georgia, has denied claims made in a recent Daily Beast article that he financed an ex-girlfriend’s abortion in 2009.

data.title: UK Finance Minister Mulls Freezing Defense Spending at 2% GDP Until 2027, Reports Say
data.description: MOSCOW (Sputnik) - UK Chancellor of the Exchequer Jeremy Hunt is considering the possibility of freezing defense spending for the next five years to fill an estimated 40-billion-pound ($45 billion) gap in the public finances, The Times newspaper reported on Saturday.

data.title: Indian Finance Minister Defends Slumping Rupee After US Fed Reserve Hikes Interest Rate
data.description: MOSCOW (Sputnik) - Indian Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman defended on Saturday the depreciating national currency after the rupee plummeted to its all-time low against the US dollar.

data.title: French Public Debt Will Top 3 Trillion Euros in Weeks: Minister
data.description: In August, France's Economy and Finance Minister Bruno Le Maire said that inflation in the country will not improve until after early 2023.

data.title: French Economy Minister Says High Inflation in France to Persist in Early 2023
data.description: PARIS (Sputnik) - French Economy and Finance Minister Bruno Le Maire said on Wednesday that the inflation situation in the country will not improve until after early 2023.

data.title: Moldova Lacks Own Funds to Offset Soaring Gas Costs to Consumers, Will Use Western Grants
data.description: CHISINAU (Sputnik) - Moldova will tap into the grants provided by Western countries to fund gas cost compensations for households, the country's Finance Minister Dumitru Budianschi said.

data.title: World Bank Grants South Africa $497 Million for Transition From Coal
data.description: After getting $8.5 billion of loans and grants for the development of greener energy sources last year, the continent's largest industry is further financed by the global institution to move from fossil fuel.

data.title: About 350 French Companies Going Through Rough Patch Over Energy Crisis
data.description: PARIS (Sputnik) - About 350 French companies are going through tough times due to the energy crisis, Industry Minister Delegate at the French Finance Ministry Roland Lescure said on Monday.

data.title: UK Prime Minister Rishi Sunak to Raise Taxes to Reduce $57.5Bln in Budget Deficit - Reports
data.description: MOSCOW1 (Sputnik) - New UK Prime Minister Rishi Sunak intends to raise taxes to cover a 50 billion pound ($57.5 billion) deficit in public finances, British media reported.

data.title: Supreme Court to Hear Case on California’s Prop 12 Ban on Gestation Crates
data.description: A study financed by the pork lobby found that pork prices in California would increase by just 7.2% in California due to Prop 12, while pork prices in the rest of the country would decrease slightly.

data.title: Chancellor of Exchequer: UK Pushes for Price Cap on Russian Oil, Hopes for G7 Support
data.description: MOSCOW (Sputnik) - The United Kingdom is actively trying to push for a price cap on Russian oil and hopes that G7 finance ministers will back robust implementation of the measure, the Chancellor of the Exchequer, Nadhim Zahawi, said on Thursday.

data.title: Estonia Issues Long-Term Bonds Worth $980Mln at 4% Interest Rate Due by 2032
data.description: MOSCOW (Sputnik) - Estonia has issued long-term government bonds with a 10-year maturity in the amount of one billion euros ($980 million) with an interest rate of 4% per annum, the country’s finance ministry said.

data.title: Poll: Half of Germans Think Government's Anti-Energy Crisis Program Pointless in Winter
data.description: MOSCOW (Sputnik) - Half of the Germans believe that the measures adopted by the federal government to combat the energy crisis will not protect their finances during winter, a survey conducted by the Institute for New Social Answers (INSA) for the German media found on Monday.

data.title: Rockhopper/Navitas plans to develop Falklands' Sea Lion offshore project in late 2023 or 2024
data.description: Falklands upstream firm Rockhopper Exploration said a final investment decision (FID) on the Falkland Islands project Sea Lion should be taken by end-2024 the latest. Officials are working on a lower upfront cost project and seeking financing.

data.title: Energy Imports to Cost Italy 3% of GDP This Year - Minister
data.description: ROME (Sputnik) - Italy could spend 60 billion euros ($59.7 billion) more on energy imports in 2022, compared to last year, which is about 3% of the country’s GDP, Minister of Economy and Finance Daniele Franco said.

data.title: Scholar: Pacific Nations Driven by Pragmatism, US Yet to Win Hearts & Minds
data.description: Washington's efforts to bolster ties with Pacific nations saw a serious setback on the eve of the September summit with the Solomon Islands rejecting a draft US agreement, and Micronesian leaders complaining about insufficient financing, according to leaked documents seen by the Guardian.

data.title: Canada's Deputy Prime Minister Freeland Could Become Next NATO Chief, Report Suggests
data.description: MOSCOW (Sputnik) - Chrystia Freeland, the deputy prime minister and finance minister of Canada, could replace Jens Stoltenberg as a NATO secretary general unless his term is extended, American newspaper reported on Friday, citing a US official familiar with the debate.

data.title: Which Western Countries Armed Ukraine
data.description: After the Euromaidan coup, they started gradually turning Ukraine into a springboard for a confrontation with Russia. NATO countries actively pumped weapons into Ukraine. They trained the Ukrainian military under the pretext of defense cooperation, and prepared Kiev for a major war. They financed Ukraine, sparing no expense.

data.title: Japan Spends Record $43Bln to Prop Up National Currency in October, Reports Say
data.description: MOSCOW (Sputnik) - The Japanese government spent a record 6.35 trillion yen ($43 billion) on more monetary interventions in October to support the national currency yen which continues to lose value, Japanese media reported on Monday. citing the finance ministry data.

data.title: 'All Hell Will Break Loose' Unless West, China Provide Pakistan With 'Urgent Debt Relief,' PM Says
data.description: Prime Minister Shehbaz Sharif’s appeal for an “urgent debt relief” comes days after the country’s finance minister assured that Islamabad won’t default on its foreign debt obligations, as it awaits billions in dollars in aid commitments from its foreign donors.

data.title: Sri Lankan Delegation Discusses Current Domestic Economic Challenges With IMF
data.description: MOSCOW (Sputnik) - Sri Lankan finance minister Shehan Semasinghe and head of the Central Bank Nandalal Weerasinghe held talks with the first deputy managing director of the International Monetary Fund (IMF), Gita Gopinath, to discuss the current domestic challenges that the country is facing.

data.title: US Federal Court Says House Ways and Means Committee Can Access Trump’s Tax Returns
data.description: WASHINGTON, (Sputnik) - The US House Ways and Means Committee is legally able to receive information from Donald Trump’s tax returns as part of the congressional panel's probe into the former president’s finances, the US District Court for the District of Columbia said in a ruling on Tuesday.

data.title: Japan's Trade Deficit Jumps to Record High of 73Bln in First Half of 2022 Fiscal Year
data.description: TOKYO (Sputnik) - Japan's trade deficit skyrocketed to 11 trillion yen ($73.37 billion) in the first half of the 2022 fiscal year that started on April 1 — a record high since 1979, when Tokyo started to collect such statistics, the Japanese Finance Ministry said on Thursday.

data.title: Ex-Australian Prime Minister Justifies Secret Self-Appointments by COVID-19 Circumstances
data.description: MOSCOW (Sputnik) - Former Australian Prime Minister Scott Morrison, who is under investigation over giving himself powers to co-minister the health, finance and resources ministries in 2020, on Tuesday justified the secret appointments by the necessity of taking "extraordinary" measures during the COVID-19 pandemic.

data.title: IMF Announces a $4.5 Bln Bailout Deal With Bangladesh Amid Dipping Forex Reserves
data.description: Bangladesh’s Finance Minister Mustafa Kamal has said that funds under the IMF package will be disbursed in seven installments from February next year till December 2026. He further claimed that Bangladesh would pay 2.2 per cent interest rate on the IMF loan.

data.title: UK Senior Officials Reportedly Back Sizewell C NPP Funding Despite Tory Split
data.description: MOSCOW (Sputnik) - UK Prime Minister Boris Johnson and Chancellor of the Exchequer Nadhim Zahawi have approved financing for the construction of two new reactors for the Sizewell C nuclear power plant (NPP) despite disagreements within the Conservative Party, The Guardian reported, citing a government source.

data.title: Kenya’s Government to Cut Borrowing Because of Budget Deficit Reduction Plans
data.description: The International Monetary Fund (IMF) - with which the Kenyan government is cooperating just now - has form when it comes to insisting that countries which receive a bail-out align their public finances with neo-liberal free-market policies such as eliminating subsidies and regulation and cutting government budgets.

data.title: UK and Kenya to Fast-Track Green Investment Projects Worth Over $4Bln
data.description: MOSCOW (Sputnik) - UK Prime Minister Rishi Sunak and Kenyan President William Ruto have agreed to accelerate the implementation of six projects worth 500 billion Kenyan shillings ($4.1 billion) to accelerate the flow of climate finance to Kenya, the UK High Commission in Nairobi said on Monday.

data.title: Sunak Hits 100 Backers in Conservative Race for Next UK Prime Minister
data.description: MOSCOW (Sputnik) - Former UK finance minister Rishi Sunak has secured the support of 100 Conservative Party members - the minimum required to get a chance of becoming the country's next prime minister, UK broadcaster Sky News reported on Friday, citing a source within Sunak's campaign.

data.title: Warrant for FBI’s Trump Raid Signed by Political Donor Judge Who Worked for Epstein
data.description: Florida Federal Magistrate Bruce Reinhart was sued by victims of child sex trafficker and abuser Jeffrey Epstein in 2011. They claimed that his defection from the US attorney's office to work for the high-flying finance tycoon in the midst of Epstein’s plea bargain helped him get off with a lighter sentence.

data.title: George Soros Bolsters Stakes in Big Tech, Snaps up Surging Amazon, Google & Tesla Shares
data.description: Soros Fund Management, formerly a New York-based hedge fund formed in 1970 by Hungarian-American investor George Soros, purchased 53 new stocks in the first fiscal quarter of 2022, with investments focused in the real estate, information technology, healthcare, finance, consumer discretionary, and communications sectors.

data.title: EU Unity Reportedly at Risk Over Price Cap on Russian Gas
data.description: The G 7 finance ministers confirmed their intention on September 2 to impose a price cap on Russian crude oil, to take effect on December 5, and on February 5, 2023, for refined products coming from the country as part of sweeping sanctions against the Moscow over its special operation in Ukraine.

data.title: Cairo Uninterested in US ‘Lecture on How to Live’ Behind Canceling $75Mln Military Aid: Ex-Diplomat
data.description: Since 1979, Egypt has been one of the largest recipients of US Foreign Military Financing (FMF), totaling $1.3 billion last year. The aid was originally conditional on Cairo maintaining its historic peace with Tel Aviv, but in late 2020, Congress added new conditions to parts of the payment.

data.title: Germans Slam Scholz’s Energy Address, Say Nation ‘on Path to Poverty’ Amid Price Hikes, Sanctions
data.description: The German Finance Ministry reported in August that energy prices had spiked by 105 percent year-on-year in 2022 thanks to shock hikes in natural gas and electricity rates. Earlier this month, the Munich-based Institute for Economic Research said it expects the country to slip “into a winter recession” due to the energy crisis.

data.title: Japan Sanctions Russian Officials Via Asset Freezes Over Accession of New Regions
data.description: TOKYO (Sputnik) - Japan has included the families of Russian Prime Minister Mikhail Mishustin, the speaker of the upper chamber of the Russian parliament, Valentina Matvienko, Security Council Deputy Chairman Dmitry Medvedev, Defense Minister Sergei Shoigu and others onto the sanctions list, the Japanese Finance ministry said on Friday.

data.title: India Facing Tough Decision Over Fate of World's Largest Free Food Program
data.description: The free food ration program was launched in April 2020 during the first nationwide COVID-19 lockdown. Under it, five kilos of wheat or rice and one of grains are provided to citizens free of charge. The Finance Ministry is against extending the program as it adds pressure to the budget deficit. The final call will be taken by the prime minister.

data.title: Business is Business: US Megabanks Revive Russian Bond Trading
data.description: The Treasury greenlit fiscal maneuvers allowing American bondholders to sell off their Russian bond holdings to non-US persons last month. The measure came following an appeal from investors, who saw their Russian assets put in limbo after US restrictions made it impossible for Russia’s Finance Ministry to pay out dividends in dollars.

data.title: No Trust for Truss: Why End is Nigh for Liz's Prime Ministership
data.description: Liz Truss' premiership is looking increasingly in peril after five weeks of navigating the country through an economic storm. On Friday, she sacked her top finance minister, Kwasi Kwarteng, and shelved her ambitious plan to reduce corporation tax. Meanwhile, the new chancellor, Jeremy Hunt, is said to be undoing Truss' other flagship policies.

data.title: India Declines to Commit to US-Proposed Price Cap on Russian Oil
data.description: US Deputy Secretary of Treasury Wally Adeyemo held wide-ranging talks with Indian officials, including finance minister Nirmala Sitharaman on August 26, also trying to persuade India to join the move. The discussion on the price cap is likely to continue next week during India's Commerce and Industry Minister Piyush Goyal's visit to the US.

data.title: Kashmiri Separatist Politician Altaf Shah Dies of Cancer at Delhi Hospital
data.description: Altaf Shah had been serving a sentence in New Delhi’s Tihar Jail for the past five years for colluding with Pakistan to finance militancy in Jammu and Kashmir. His family, however, referred to him as a “political prisoner.” Altaf was son-in-law of separatist leader Syed Ali Geelani and a member of the political group Tehreek-e-Hurriyat.

data.title: India Raids Fintech Firms Allegedly Hosting Chinese Loan Sharks
data.description: Delhi’s Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman told parliament that the government was taking action against what she coined as dubious online loan companies last month, many of which she claimed to have originated from “one particular country”. She also vowed action against those who assisted the instantly-approved loan firms.
